website_summaries.verdict: For easy, seamless DIY home security and automation integration, look no further than the Piper NV.
pros: From setup to shutdown, Icontrol Networks' $269 or £230 Piper NV all-in-one security device was an absolute delight to use
cons: You'll spend more upfront than some other standalone security options
It doesn't have an IFTTT channel or offer partnerships with third-party brands beyond its basic Z-Wave integrations

customer_reviews.title: I really want to recommend this, it's almost a great system
customer_reviews.text: I really want to recommend this, it's almost a great system, except for it's tendency to randomly disconnect if it doesn't get a strong enough wifi signal. Tech support says the only way to fix this is to manually reboot the router, and then improve the reception of the single. Of course, without a way to tell whether Piper is receiving a strong enough wifi signal there's no way to tell whether it will randomly disconnect. Tech support assures me this is normal and the unit is functioning as designed. If that's the case then it's just not suitable as a security system. Maybe as a nanny cam.
customer_reviews.author: Scritty

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable and connection problems
customer_reviews.text: Bought two Pipers, one regular and one NV both of them had random disconnect problems. Tried multiple cell phones and internet providers but never had perfect connection. Sometime it would be good for a couple weeks and then random connection issues returned. One of the Pipers completely stopped working after a year and a half and does not turn on any longer. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware...
customer_reviews.text: Very simple to setup. And very simple to use. When it works. When things go wrong, it is incredibly difficult to fix. Factory reset is a complex process. I could not perform a factory reset on my unit. I called customer support and the serial number on my unit wasn't in their database, and after 10 minutes trying to diagnose the problem the support person had been unable to fix my unit. So while it worked well - at first, once things went wrong I couldn't get it fixed. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great concept.  Big disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a few months. Kinda glitchy but I liked the ability to check my office. Bought a second one for my house. I had someone checking on my cats every day while traveling and piper never alerted me- not once in seven days. Now neither unit works--software is limited in what you can do and shallow support. Enormous waste of money and can't return.
customer_reviews.author: kurtisroy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Everything I expected it to be. A lot of people were asking what the night vision looks like, attached is an image. I think its pretty good. (It looks a little bit better than the screenshot that I attached, for some reason my phone screenshot button brightened this image up a tad bit). I bought this product with the recommended door/window sensors. You have the option to set it up to call or text you if it spots anything, it will also record video and send it to your phone. It also monitors temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gets knocked offline and can't reconnect
customer_reviews.text: The Piper was easy to set up and worked great for a couple months. Then I received a message that it was offline. The only way to re-set it is to re-set the actual unit. That defeats the purpose, since it is monitoring a remote home. Next time I was there I re-set it and, again, it worked for a couple months. This has happened three times now. The pleasant woman at customer support didn't have a solution. My Nest devices are working fine, so it is not a wifi or internet connectivity problem--it is a Piper can't reconnect problem. I guess I'll try Nest now.
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Piper NV Rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 Piper NV units and they all work great! Moreover, I use 1-2 units in my rental homes when they are vacant along with a Wifi Hotspot I have. The units are VERY reliable and easy to set up. I have Z-Wave switches, sensors and light bulbs throughout my primary home and I LOVE how I can program these to go off/on based on whatever rules I program. I think some of the negative reviews are from people that do not follow instructions and don't know how to set up a Piper. I have called Technical Support and it was also very good! In summary, Piper NV is a great value with great features and reliability!!
customer_reviews.author: t594

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Seriously. Don't waste your money. We've had our piper camera for about a year and its terrible. The first few months, it worked just fine. But after about 3 months, the app stopped connecting to the camera, the motion detection stopped working and it kept reporting errors when trying to adjust any of the settings. We only use it now as a dog watching camera and nothing more. I can't bring myself to spend more money on another camera that could possibly be just as bad, since Piper wasn't cheap in the first place! Very disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Incompetent
customer_reviews.text: Constantly having to stop app on phone and restart in order to connect and disarm. Constantly having to wait and wait for it to connect in order to arm when leaving. Every once in a while it completely dumps my account and I have to set it up all over again for no apparent reason. I make software for a living. These people don't know what they're doing. Completely incompetent.
customer_reviews.author: Mark on Amzon

customer_reviews.title: To Date, THE Smartest Home Security System!
customer_reviews.text: outstanding experience with Piper, they've made numerous improvement on the Apple APP which have indeed addressed ALL issues. Reliable, consistent, multiple security modes provide flexibility and allow you to sleep soundly knowing the alarm will trigger and video capture of intruders. I have purchased Foscam, Ring and MyDlink, to date Piper exceeds in performance. One recommendation is to consider a 4G network as opposed to WIFI, companies like Verizon have a router specific website that lists all devices using WIFI, making it easy to deactivate the Piper and any other camera requiring WIFI.
customer_reviews.author: Kiki

customer_reviews.title: Actually, bad.
customer_reviews.text: Unreliable and not worth the money. We have lots of connection issues with ours. I like the idea of this and it worked well for about 6 months, but not it's essentially useless. I will not longer record events in any way that is even remotely reliable. It also won't stream reliably or link to any z-wave devices at all. I had previously used an old iPhone and a free app that was honestly better than this. If they could get it to work as advertised I'd be happy but that has not been my experience.
customer_reviews.author: James Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: I've had my Piper NV for several months now and everything works perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I've had my Piper NV for several months now and everything works perfect. In fact I have not had a single issue with anything. I just wish they would release some additional accessories such as add on mini-cams that can be linked together instead of having to buy multiple Pipers. Otherwise no complaints about the device itself, and it does everything it advertises. I recommend it to my friends as well which I never do unless I am very satisfied with a product. Nice to not need a subscription and the app works on my iPhone perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: MattG

customer_reviews.title: Camera is useless now
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had two pipers since 2015. They worked fine until Around 1.5 years ago, when they stated getting funky. In the last 7 months the camera has become useless. It’s never connected, Piper’s own accessories won’t pair with it. This camera is going the way of the rest, in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: andrew

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money like I did
customer_reviews.text: Product was working well for a little over a year and suddenly stopped connecting to my home network. I made no changes to my ISP, computer, etc. and the company claims it is an issue with my internet connection. None of my electronic devices that use my wireless connection have experienced this issue. I have been communicating back and forth with Piper's customer service and they are some of the most unhelpful people I've encountered. Don't waste your money like I did.
customer_reviews.author: Paola Lagac

customer_reviews.title: Good Product, Good App
customer_reviews.text: Everything works as advertised. Setup was easy and stable. I think the addition of garage door up/down sensor and remote garage door control would be a great addition. I used a competitors product and app to add that feature. I think a z-wave deadbolt lock would be a great addition. I am waiting for Piper to announce compatibility. The addition of more pipers to extend sensors is great however, the addition of a Piper does not extend the z-wave sensor range (as you would think).... this is not mentioned in their specs and I think this should be a feature. I would like a wall mounted arm/disarm panel as an option.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Technology needs work.
customer_reviews.text: I had to try five of these cameras to find two that would connect using Google Fiber. Called customer service who told me to keep trying over and over again until the camera would connect. It didn't. On the other hand, the Piper cameras in my other home running on XFinity were easy to set up with an immediate connection.
customer_reviews.author: Mary McLeod

customer_reviews.title: Still working after 4 years
customer_reviews.text: I love that you can program this to call you or someone you choose in the event that it senses motion in the house. It also records after each motion detection. Our house was broken into and this little device called me as soon as it detected the motion. It also recorded the person that broke i which allowed me to provide the police with a clear description.
customer_reviews.author: Joel C.

customer_reviews.title: This device is amazing and exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Fully exceeded expectations. I waited to buy a security system over these past few years and the wait was absolutely worth it. This device is amazing and exactly what I was looking for! The setup took maybe 20 minutes, downloaded the app, plugged in the device, registered and it starting working perfectly. I was able to see full video of my lower level, including all three exterior doors. The security settings were super easy to configure. I tested it the first night and caught my wife making a midnight snack!! Love this thing!!
customer_reviews.author: B. Gallaway

customer_reviews.title: i would recommend this camera
customer_reviews.text: Yes it makes me feel like my place is secure, it is one of the best if not best out I think. The only thing I would change and is the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is to be able to turn off and on the camera from your phone, like control totally off and on like where the little green light goes out and the infrared light shuts off and connection is turned off, but other than that I'm very happy with the camera!
customer_reviews.author: CypTech

customer_reviews.title: Highly Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: We ranked this 1 star because we were not impressed. We have been researching for about 5 months and this unit seemed to cover all of our needs. It has a sleek appearance but performance was lacking. The video pixels are distorted unless you are standing completely still-- what robber is going to "vogue" for the camera???? The "intercom" type feature was completely useless-- could not communicate at all. We are returning the unit and will continue to look for the right fit for our needs.
customer_reviews.author: EHF

customer_reviews.title: review for durability, not functionality, which also sucks
customer_reviews.text: I had the product for 4 months before i had to change the wifi password and the thing would never reset to accept the password and work again. A couple of months later, i tried again to unplug and reset it to accept the new password and it died. returning today. owned for 7 months. did nothing.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: It was good the year it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Mine stopped working and after multiple resets, walk throughs with customer support and begging it to restart, it never connected again. I gave up. It was good the year it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: challruss

customer_reviews.title: We bought this in early September 2016. A few ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this in early September 2016. A few days ago January 11, 2017, the "loud sound" detection alarm started going off in the middle of the night scaring the heck of us. We were all sound asleep and nothing had fallen or caused the sound. Despite resetting it and talking to Piper, no reason for this was found. The returns policy expired after a month of purchase and now we can either return the item for repair (if they can duplicate the problem ) or turn off the loud sound detection sensor and disable it permanently. :(((
customer_reviews.author: Lori E

customer_reviews.title: Do not tecommend. Have used since Beta units.
customer_reviews.text: Absolute joke, do not waste your money. I have purchased multiple units with multiple accessories and switches. Rarely will it go more than a month and function without some sort of reboot or rest required. The pairing of it's switches (door/window contacts) is a lesson in insanity. Customer service is of course a canned email reply essentially requiring you to spend the balance of your day reinstalling the entire system.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Franklin

customer_reviews.title: The product works ok when it actually works, the ...
customer_reviews.text: The product works ok when it actually works, the problem is that it gets disconnected all the time, you have to constantly re conect which defeats the purpose of a surveillance camera! I bought 2, one for my house and one for my business is very disappointing that it does not work when you want to review and event you open the app boomer!!! Lost connection. Piper representatives are ok for service the problem is they always guide you to reconnect! Well the problem is that I don't want to f reconnect I want the product to work all the time, if you want it for your business or watching your home definitely stay away from this product!
customer_reviews.author: pedro d font

customer_reviews.title: Reliable video feed, but lacking in key features.
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is sleek and works well. The live video feed is great and the night vision work surprisingly well. However, it is lacking some very important features. I would like the ability to use this as audio only on occasion. I would also like to be able to choose the "loudness" of noise in which I am to be alerted about. It needs to the ability to choose when to record a clip (not just when an "event" occurs) and to have internal storage, or at least attach external storage so that you can save the recorded clip to this storage. This has potential, but isn't quite there yet.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Minnema

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working 3 months outside of the warranty. Tried factory resetting and reinstalling the app, but the app will not reconnect to the device. When it works it's not a bad home security solution. Unfortunately, the app loses connection to the device frequently, loads slow, and the hardware is apparently unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Cliver

customer_reviews.title: Its ok but far from great
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to set up. When I ran into a problem, the person at the other end of the 1-800 number was able to help me very quickly. The problem with this device is if it loses its connection (and it will) to the internet, there is no way to arm or more importantly disarm it. I found out that the alarm is very loud and it will go off even without an internet connection. At this point the only thing to do is unplug and remove the backup battery. Needless to say my neighbors were not happy. Since the last time this happened I have not turned it back on.
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: Night Vision does not work!
customer_reviews.text: I paid a higher price for the NV, thinking I would receive the Night Vision it promised me. Instead, it's just pitch black. Believe me when I say that I am so frustrated! I toggled it on, make sure it wasn't surrounding light around disrupting it,literally everything out of the book. I even stuck it in a closet & closed the door! I will be contacting the company tomorrow to resolve this situation. I will update review as soon as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Hagan

customer_reviews.title: False advertising from the seller.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this piper, because it mentioned having “night vision” IT DOES NOT. And on top of it the video quality is terrible, you hardly see what is going on. I own two other Pipers that have great camera quality, so I know what it should be. Very disappointed .
customer_reviews.author: Walker

customer_reviews.title: I would not consider this to be a serious solution ...
customer_reviews.text: I would not consider this to be a serious solution to home security. It loses its connection to wifi at least once a week even though roku tv, laptops, phones all continue to work perfectly. Each time it loses its connection, it is a major process to get it back online. I think if they could work the bugs out, it has real possibilities, especially if it had the ability to expand the system with additional cameras or smoke detectors. Presently it is no more than a novelty item to maybe look at your dog on your cell phone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: Every time I have a power issue, or a network issue... these things forget who they are and have to be set up over again. a complete waste.
customer_reviews.author: Akien MacIain

customer_reviews.title: Electronic Doorman
customer_reviews.text: I live in a condo; only one way in-n-out with windows high above the ground. I don't worry about a "break-in". Rather, I am concerned about unauthorized entry. I arm my Piper when I leave. "Peter Piper" then stands guard ready to inform me of unauthorized entry. If there is such event I get a video clip of who, what and when, just what I'll need to have when my questions are ask and answered.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Ham

customer_reviews.title: Too waste of time
customer_reviews.text: The camera software crashes often. Must take off the batteries and set it up again. Too waste of time. Whenever you need it most it doesn’t work properly. The alarm might also trigger and you won’t be able to turn it off until you take off the batteries. Don’t buy this product. Go to Arlo or Canary or ring. Are much more serious those.
customer_reviews.author: Emoroian

customer_reviews.title: Fatal Flaw, cannot gracefully handle network outage.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product except for one major fatal flaw. If the network connectivity goes down for more than about 5 minutes, Piper cannot reconnect. You must reinstall as if out of the box, and all your settings are also lost. If you are out of town, one extended ISP problem (such as your cable down) makes the product useless until you return and reconfigure from scratch. Product support has not gotten any indicatio that this will be fixed. Don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and use
customer_reviews.text: We purchased Piper because our old alarm system stopped working. The only downside I have found thus far is Piper always recognizes our small dog and sets off the motion alarm. Other than that it seems to be a great system. We have had no false alarms that we have not caused. I really like the feature that records any activity that causes an alarm activation and stores it in the cloud. We have our Piper set so that it beeps, my thought is if someone does break in and hears the beeping they may walk toward it and in doing so give us a perfect shot of their face.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Pigg

customer_reviews.title: A generous 3 stars
customer_reviews.text: After doing a ton of research Piper vs. Canary vs. Simplisafe vs. the plethora of other options out there, I decided on Piper. I've been plagued by constant connection issues. To their credit, Piper Support is responsive and tries their best, but unfortunately are hamstrung by questionable technology, and can only blame 'weak' wireless signals. Could be just a 1-off bad experience (I will be testing another pair of Pipers in a different house/location shortly), so the 3 stars here are a little generous and giving the product the benefit of the doubt.
customer_reviews.author: Sukiyaki

customer_reviews.title: Its headed in the right direction. The interface has ...
customer_reviews.text: Its headed in the right direction. The interface has been updated twice since I've owned it, so know that they are working hard on in. There is no Web access from a computer, so you must use it from a phone or tablet. My only BIG complaint is that once the device has detected motion, it will not continue to record any other motion until you have reset the device. I feel that any motion after the trip should be recorded as well. It does look and feel solid, and provides an incredible view point. I can see almost a full 180 degrees with its fish eye lens.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hall

customer_reviews.title: The picture quality is amazing (the fish eye lens covers a greater span than ...
customer_reviews.text: The new update fixed nearly everything I was iffy about with Piper when I first purchased it. It re-arms the alarm, the live stream is now designed for full screen mode on my iPhone 6s+, and the connection is a lot faster (or so it seems). The picture quality is amazing (the fish eye lens covers a greater span than I thought it would) as well as the two-way microphone. I plan on purchasing a few more to put around my home - I wish there was an outdoor version and more z-wave options.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: This was the perfect solution for our vacation home!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this. Instead of paying $25/month for monitoring at my cottage, I paid $20/month for internet access and hooked up the piper. I also have wirelessly interconnected smoke/CO alarms throughout the house. If one goes off, they all do (I use the Piper loud noise monitoring to catch this). This paired with the PiperNV makes a perfect system. Mostly it just catches maintenance people coming and going, but it is definitely doing its job!!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Actually works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Ordered Piper NV because I was moving from a home into an apartment and wanted a little bit more security. I initially tested in my home and it worked great. After I moved it was easy to reset it for my apartment and I work just as well. I set Piper so I could see the front door of my apartment and part of my kitchen and I actually could watch service people doing repairs in my kitchen. I did extensive review of this type of product and Piper always came out as the best product of it's type.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin J. Gooze

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Security
customer_reviews.text: It's always on, always accessible day or night (the nv model). The Infrared lighting built in makes night look like day in the whole room. Other devices I have seen don't come close. Very configurable. Even has a pet setting to keep pets from triggering it although when the cat jumped right in front of it, it did register the movement. On a recent trip I was able to connect and talk to my daughter through it when she came over to feed the cat. I am very pleased with this device and may buy a second one for another area in the house.
customer_reviews.author: GeorgeB

customer_reviews.title: Piper, works as advertised, needs a software fix
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Great way to monitor activity in your home. Nice user controls to customize notices via text or call if piper detects unwanted activity in your home. One big disadvantage: if for any reason ( power off, router temporary down), piper "cannot connect with network", and one is on vacation), cannot remotely reset unit, must be home in front of it. That spoils your efforts at monitoring home while on holiday, needs to be fixed.
customer_reviews.author: jimmied

customer_reviews.title: 6 months and working great
customer_reviews.text: Piper is at a point where it can see main doors and access from basement. We have an outdoor siren and flashing LED device to augment the piper's siren. We have 3 door sensors, 2 motion sensors and a water sensor. It all works very well and replaced a monitoring service alarm so has more or less paid for itself already. Being able to select the alarm away and at home configurations works very well and having remote access via smart phone is extremely convenient. Even the noise sensor tells us if a package was delivered and they rang the doorbell. We use the push notifications, which comes up on my smart watch so very convenient and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Once I unhooked from electricity and pulled out the battery and left it for a half hour and then re-installed it seems to be wor
customer_reviews.text: Works but was dropping the wifi connection and was also sending us bogus temperature reports. Once I unhooked from electricity and pulled out the battery and left it for a half hour and then re-installed it seems to be working better. I tried to take battery and unhook from electricity once before but I guess I did not leave it unconnected long enough to re-set. The re-set button does not work and disconnecting from all power sources seemed to have done the trick. Support was helpful as well.
customer_reviews.author: Darcy

customer_reviews.title: App constantly crashes.  Un-reliable!!
customer_reviews.text: For the first couple months, it worked OK. Connection was slow... and then... The light started turning on randomly (when neither me or my wife was on the app). The humidity, light, microphone sensors constantly pick up data from your home, and send it to Piper unsecured. Also, you can NOT opt out of this major privacy flaw (and ability to track your comings/goings). Then the app just stopped working. After multiple reboots, re-installs, factory resets of the camera, it still doesn't work. So I am officially calling mine bricked after a little more than 8 months of ownership. The app is the ONLY method to access Piper too.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it. For the price I got; it's an awesome deal. The software still needs some much added options but the company seems very active on this front. The software that is current works well. I had a few issues getting connected to my WIFI, but a quick call to support fixed that. Can't wait to start adding accessories.
customer_reviews.author: David B Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Good hardware, clunky software
customer_reviews.text: I have really mixed feelings when it comes to piper -- I like that it has a separate motion detector and that it connects to z-wave devices, but I found the software experience to be extremely confusing and cumbersome. the interface seems really disjointed and hard to differentiate what you can customize and what you can't. I ended up getting a bunch of silent alarms -- the alarms are difficult to work through and overall, it just feels clunky with a half-finished interface. While I can appreciate the hardware finish, I think the app experience is super important and unfortunately pipers just doesn't cut it forbme.
customer_reviews.author: Homesmarthome

customer_reviews.title: securing connection...
customer_reviews.text: A good idea with terrible execution. First, one can only use a mobile device to monitor, so no pc interface. Second, most of the time when I try to check my piper using my mobioe device, it won't even connect...even if I'm standing right next to it. All I get is "securing connection..." for a minute or two, then the option to retry, ignore, or troubleshoot. When I troubleshoot it asks what color the LED is, to which I answer "green." It then states that I need to toggle my wi-fi connection. This does not help...ever. Useless.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hope that you do not have a problem. Ours ...
customer_reviews.text: Hope that you do not have a problem. Ours would drop off our WiFi every week or so (no other devices did this) and then stopped working at all, no LEDs etc. Contacted Piper for a repair, and instead have been told over and over to unplug, wait a while, then connect only the power adapter, then try only batteries, ad infinitum. So when it works it works, but if it does not it seems to take a long long time to actually get an RMA to return for repair. I still do not have an RMA at this point. The unit failed after about 60 days of use.
customer_reviews.author: Herb Guenther

customer_reviews.title: a welcomed guest
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this device for our 2nd home. I wanted some peace of mind when we were not there and some extra security when we are there. I find the device very well thought out and with some learning on my part works as expected. The only issue I have is forgetting to press 'done' when programming the alarm so sometimes its not activated when I make changes.
customer_reviews.author: simpleperson

customer_reviews.title: Good, but for the price I was expecting greater z-wave compatibility.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Easy to setup, fairly good picture quality, sleek design, simple app UI, no monthly charges. Cons: no PC based control, limited z-wave compatibility (can't control my Yale Real Living Deadbolt - I'm returning it because of this), the night-vision 'auto' setting remains in night mode while I consider it fairly light inside. Going to look for a lower price camera and separate z-wave controller.
customer_reviews.author: JJC

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.text: Great concept. Poor delivery. Camera sucks! Especially in night mode. Over heats. Software is super buggy. Ifttt channels are lame. Hopefully they use all the money they have made to overhaul the entire unit or nest will bury them...
customer_reviews.author: Michael Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent DIY Security System
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Piper NV for my second home. I read the CNet report and reviews on Amazon before determining that Piper NV was the best choice for my needs. So far I have not been disappointed, It was easy to set up & allows me to keep an eye on my condo which is over 1,000 miles away. The video day vision is in color and the night vision is excellent. I plan to expand the system by adding my electronic door lock, lights, a window sensor and thermostat in the near future and will update my review in the future regarding how well that goes.
customer_reviews.author: Faye

customer_reviews.title: fix the temperature glitch, piper
customer_reviews.text: works well for me with one glaring exception. it repeatedly sends push notifications once the temperature drops to 65 degrees or lower even though all notification buttons in setup panels are off. I've awoken many times 20 or more push notifications about a temperature change. without that glitch, my rating would be much higher.
customer_reviews.author: paul

customer_reviews.title: Great device that works...
customer_reviews.text: This device worked for me as advertised. Yes, it does transmit some artifact noise when viewing the panorama picture mode on a cellphone, but this is not a big deal. The night vision is cool too. I am so satisfied that I am adding an additional unit for my ground-floor condo (one to monitor the front door, one to monitor the back patio door).
customer_reviews.author: Mark R.

customer_reviews.title: Great product -- when it works
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it is fantastic. Unfortunately, it seems to continually have glitches. Have to reboot it about once a week. That's fine when I'm home, but it's a real pain when I'm out of town and unable to reboot it in person. I love the unlimited storage of video clips, and no monthly subscription fee. But the constant technical glitches really frustrate me.
customer_reviews.author: Neal Stein

customer_reviews.title: Loved the first one so much I bought a second ...
customer_reviews.text: Loved the first one so much I bought a second unit for my office. The super wide angle lens makes it possible to monitor both front and back doors with one unit. I love the integration with Life360 as it reminds us when to arm the system. One thing for the wish list is a local panel to arm/disarm the unit using a Z-wave device (with a PIN) just in case the network is down.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It was very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I've researched different security systems and chose the Piper NV. It was very easy to set up, my 16 year old got it working in no time. I use it to keep an eye on my dogs at home and to check on my kids after school. I love that it has a wide angle of viewing and you can move it around. It doesn't affect my internet as much as I thought it would so I keep it on all day. My sister has another known brand system and she turns it off after work so it doesn't interfere with her network. I will order additional units to be placed around my house and one for my business.
customer_reviews.author: Namphuongb

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my choice
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I went with this camera. I use it primarily to keep an eye on my dogs when I'm out. I also use it to watch what's going on when my apartment management needs to come inside when I'm not home. The app has some flaws after the recent update, but the camera itself is great. Good quality video, wide angle, and has minimal lag. Also works with a door sensor so I can get alerts immediately when the door opens.
customer_reviews.author: AS

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced and they have removed features since I purchased it
customer_reviews.text: This camera is fine for what it is. Overpriced, but fine. However, one of the main reasons I purchased it was for its IFTTT integration - something they advertised at the time. They just removed that this week, which makes this MUCH less useful to me. I had all my schedules set up with IFTTT along with widgets on my phone so I could easily turn it on and off. Would return this if I could.
customer_reviews.author: bobtables

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Fails on a regular basis when we are not at home to reset it. Unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: Sarookh52

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Just received the Piper camera and will be sending it back. This was clearly a returned and apparently used unit. The packaging was not as it must have been originally. The unit itself is scratched, smudged and dirty and even had a moth web in the battery compartment! I thought the cord was frayed but upon closer examination had food or dirt imbedded in it. Very disappointed with the QC on this product and debating whether or not reorder another.
customer_reviews.author: AMS

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Camera System
customer_reviews.text: I have two Piper cameras in my home. I have the basic camera set up in my living room and the upgrade higher definition camera in the Family room. They were very easy to set up and utilize. The App download is simple and easy as well. My only negative comment would be the the clarity of the cameras leave a little to be desired. The higher def camera offers better night time vision but in terms of clarity, very little improvement over the Basic. Never there less, great equipment for security. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Becker

customer_reviews.title: Wait for a device that works and does what it states it will do
customer_reviews.text: This does not work well. It doesn't sense me unless I am right in front and to get the siren to go off you have to unscrew the back much to my dog's ears dismay. I hope someone creates an all in one system with the camera, motion sensor and alarm that actually works.
customer_reviews.author: AmerAsian

customer_reviews.title: Performance is horrible.
customer_reviews.text: I just set up a Piper classic & tho I have good wi-fi (laptops have no issue from same location), Piper keeps losing connection!
customer_reviews.author: Bibliophile

customer_reviews.title: Nearly perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this device! Increadibly easy to use and operate, installation was a snap. The one feature that I think really lacks is an app for my PC to tie in and view live. I can't get a cell signal where I work so I can't check in when I want, I do have PC and internet access that would fill that gap if available. At least it will make short recordings that will store and I can access later. 5th star will come with a PC app.
customer_reviews.author: L. Lorden

customer_reviews.title: Love it, easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Love it, easy set up, can download recorded video clips to iPhone, and good picture quality day or night. Wish you could program it to turn on alarm mode at certain times so you don't have to remember to manually set it.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle M.

customer_reviews.title: Damaged in shipping but the unit works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Unit showed up with a loose part on the inside. After using it for a month, all has been ok but I decided to crack it open to see what was loose. The top speaker broke free of the top of the unit. I glued it back and now I'm happy. It must have broken loose during shipping. Other than that, the unit seems to work pretty well. Once it dropped off the network and I had no access to it all day from work. At this point I'll add a few accessories since overall the unit works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT SMYTH

customer_reviews.title: Piper is amazing and still a work in progress
customer_reviews.text: Piper is amazing and still a work in progress. I can't wait for it to interact with my Echo. There are currently no Recepies for the piper on IFTTT. Hope they will show up soon. The interaction with Life360 is spotty at best. Only works once in a while. Needs to work every time. Would be great if I could set it up to arm automatically once I leave my home and disarm when I get home.
customer_reviews.author: Donald C Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Misrepresentation of Product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product thinking I was getting a Piper with Night Vision. Instead I got a Piper "Classic" that does not have night vision. I returned the product. I'm not sure if this was done on purpose but the box indicated it was a classic while there was a sticker on the cellophane wrapping on the box that said nv. Either way, if you order this product check the box to make sure that it has night vision as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Joseph L Bedard

customer_reviews.title: One of the best
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. I have 2 and will likely add a third for my home security. The alarm is loud and startling. The picture during the day and with infrared at night is excellent. My only complaint is a small one. When I bring the live view on my iPad it comes up in landscape view but does not flip if I am holding the iPad "upside down". The reason this is an issue for me is im left handed and my iPad is usually upside down in a right handed world.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Jim

customer_reviews.title: Meets my needs
customer_reviews.text: I really like the piper and it mostly fits my needs. The delay between alarm notification and the ability to see videos makes it a bit rough to determine necessity of police notification. Otherwise serves its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Fran

customer_reviews.title: It does everything I need it to do
customer_reviews.text: I've had the Piper for about a month. I keep it on a shelf in my open concept living room in my condo so I can see pretty much throughout the entire condo. I researched all the home security cameras and opted for this one because I did not want one dependent on a subscription service. I also considered cost effectiveness. I'm happy with the app. The video quality is good. I've only had a one time issue with connectivity. Whatever it was, it resolved without any intervention.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: One small problem
customer_reviews.text: unfortunately all a bad guy has to do is to cut your dsl or fiber optic cable outside and then all the piper will do is sound an alarm, it cannot notify you. I do believe that is still records but it cannot go anywhere so you do not have the recording later to see who the bad guy is even if he did not take or destroy the piper.
customer_reviews.author: B. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great security camera
customer_reviews.text: I did a bunch of research before buying the piper, and am very happy with my decision. Both the day and night modes work well, and the fisheye lens offers a broad view. The app was easy to configure, and the motion/sound detection work well. The piper now supports IFTTT integration, which greatly expands its capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: So Easy
customer_reviews.text: I have places a Piper in my living room, kitchen and facing into our back yard. I placed them in strategic locations where I can see my elderly mother during the day while I am at work. If she were to fall I would be able to get help for her quickly. I can see what is on the TV and get my daughter who lives next door to come over and change the channel to something else if it winds up on something boring. I feel much better knowing what she is up to when I'm gone from the house.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne Lawson

customer_reviews.title: I needed a way to keep track of an elderly ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed a way to keep track of an elderly family member during the day. I considered three different brands and after my research I decided on Piper because of the speaker function and night vision option. I had a little problem with set up, but that was probably just me. I can now check in throughout the day without being obtrusive and put my mind at ease.One day I thought I heard water running but I couldn't see anything. With a door open the mic could pick up on Mom watering her garden. Now I just need a water resistent model.
customer_reviews.author: Jpepper

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I needed to be able to monitor the status of an invalid and also to be able to have two-way communication with that individual when I must be out of the house. Piper nv has lived up to all expectations. The picture is sharp and the sound system quite clear. I also get alerts exactly as specified in the rules that were established. Set up was simple and quick. I look forward to adding on to the system.
customer_reviews.author: Las Vegas Don

customer_reviews.title: Piper NV constant connection issues
customer_reviews.text: Been using the normal Piper for years now. It's been pretty good for reliability. I bought the piper NV back in June and it has been a pain. It won't connect consistently and if I do get it to connect, via a reboot, the video works for about 5 seconds and then freezes. My old piper works much better. Maybe mine is defective bit I'd avoid the piper NV.
customer_reviews.author: Blackcoog

customer_reviews.title: I am rewriting my review of piper nv after using ...
customer_reviews.text: I am rewriting my review of piper nv after using it for two months because of the loud sound detector that is too sensitive to the extent that the alarm is triggered a few times a day even with nobody living in the house and the house is located in a dead end street with no through traffic. And the picture always in black and white and have to reset it manually to color most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Chow

customer_reviews.title: So far we are happy with this unit
customer_reviews.text: So far we are happy with this unit. We've had two false alarms. One for a door opening that didn't and another when the cat walked through a bright spot of light coming through the window. Pairing z wave units was tough and took several tries for each one. But since then they've worked flawlessly. The auto arm feature using the life360 app is very handy. I only wish they'd come out with auto disarm.
customer_reviews.author: Sewards in the Desert

customer_reviews.title: The only thing that would make this better is if it was compatible with Windows
customer_reviews.text: The only thing that would make this better is if it was compatible with Windows. I love that it records video and audio and stores it on the cloud. It emits a high pitched siren that lets you know its been activated. It lets you know through text and email when a loud noise has been detected, or movement, or when the temperature has changed. It was also fairly easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Benecke

customer_reviews.title: Good hardware, bad software
customer_reviews.text: Good quality camera, but the software makes this product hard to operate - with my Android (5.1) I need to reset the camera and re-install it almost every time I want to use it. And even if it works, I find the software slow, awkward and hard to handle. Another minus is that multiple cameras view is impossible. On the plus side - the camera produces a great quality picture. Bottom line - Piper - fix the software. Then you'll have a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It simply works, simply
customer_reviews.text: I love this little thing. Set up was easy, including adding two sensors, alarms, notifications (it calls me when there is an issue!!), web apps works well even when we are ourside the US.etc. It simply works simply. Will be adding more sensors over time. The fisheye lens does take some getting use to, but no issues. Would like to see some level of integration with Alexa for more complete home automation, but not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Piper - Home Automation
customer_reviews.text: Kept in Family Room. Acts as an hub to all other z-wave products & helps me automate & schedule based on the various event/time. It can be become an excellent product, once it's able to support any z-wave product and acts as a single hub for complete automation.
customer_reviews.author: Rajesh Nair

customer_reviews.title: Piper does not stand behind its warrany
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Piper NV and it worked well for several months. It suddenly stopped working, and I contacted the support department. They asked me to reinstall the piper and I spent several hours doing whatever they recommended. It didn't work. I then asked for instructions as to where I can send the Piper for repair, and they went silent on me.
customer_reviews.author: ymcebs

customer_reviews.title: Security Camera
customer_reviews.text: Security system arrived in a timely manner, in a well insulated, well sealed box, with lots of padding to protect the camera. The camera was very easy to install in our Airstream Trailer. I will be able to move it about to other locations of concern if I need to. I thank you for this wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: Ruby Jane

customer_reviews.title: Poor transmission or timelag
customer_reviews.text: I had high expectations. I tried using it as a baby monitor. But the monitoring has a timelag sometimes as bad as a few minutes. It never shows what is currently happening in the room. Instead it shows what happned a few mins back..It defeats the purpose. It may have worked for others. But looks like I will be returning this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bharat Mirgan

customer_reviews.title: it seemed to work fine. It integrated with a door switch and plug ...
customer_reviews.text: WARNING: This does not detect motion through glass. If you were planning to point this outside your front window and notify you when people are on your property (like I did) it won't work. Otherwise, it seemed to work fine. It integrated with a door switch and plug pretty easily, and the rules were easy to set up. Had to return though because I wanted it to monitor the outside from inside.
customer_reviews.author: R. H.

customer_reviews.title: Latest Update Broke Unit?
customer_reviews.text: Update: Piper followed thru on their promise to me and patched the iOS app on 23Jan17 so I'm fully functional again. Device was working fine for nearly a year, including two-Piper functionality but suddenly the app cannot connect to either Piper unless I'm home on the wifi. As soon as I leave the house, it's unreachable.
customer_reviews.author: TM

customer_reviews.title: Unresolved blocker for Nexus 6
customer_reviews.text: Does not work with Android Marshmellow - complete setup failure. Piper support, "We have it in record and our team has been working on it, I can file a ticket with our other teams but it is an issue they are all aware of. I hear your concerns but you're concerns."
customer_reviews.author: Maksum

customer_reviews.title: Cons: After it makes a recording, it will ...
customer_reviews.text: Cons: After it makes a recording, it will not make another recording until you disarm and rearm the device. Cannot detect motion through a window. Nightvision keeps activating and disabling if pointed at a window. Not enough control for sound/motion sensitivity.
customer_reviews.author: AW

customer_reviews.title: Trouble getting it to work with my router, repeatedly having to set it up
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for a few months and there have been multiple times I haven't been able to connect to it when I'm away. I like to be able to converse with my kids when it does work. It keeps getting disconnected from my router and refuses to acknowledge the router or to find the router, a TP LINK that works with everything else I own.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, solid home monitoring
customer_reviews.text: If you need an inexpensive, reliable way to keep tabs on your house, this is it. It does take a little bit of patience to set it up. Once it is in, it works great. Simply set the away mode and it monitors the house sending you and your trusted network either e-mail, calls, or SMS plus the app gets alerts.
customer_reviews.author: gogowiz1

customer_reviews.title: Works well now.
customer_reviews.text: Got first Piper and put in my living room. Liked it so much that I got a second one and put it in my office. It malfunctioned and, after several phone calls and instructions on how to reboot it, I finally had to send it back. I subsequently was sent a new one and so far it works well. I have 2 lights connected to the system and can program them to turn on & off while I'm away. It's fun checking up on my dog while I'm out of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Don H. Vater

customer_reviews.title: Piper NV review
customer_reviews.text: Purchased our Piper NV in early Sep-2016. Have been very pleased with it's capabilities & performance; motion & loud noise detection (even our cat wailing). Our unit can "see" the rear entrances of our home & we added a door sensor for our front entrance & water sensors for our sump pump & water heater.
customer_reviews.author: Brike

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: The thing has some great features and a ton of potential, but needs some massive refinement. I'm returning it. Major problem: way to cumbersome to setup. Other problems: device makes a sound when you arm it which can't be turned off in the settings. The 30ish second video clips are too short. It should give me the option to change the duration.
customer_reviews.author: Bored Dad is Bored

customer_reviews.title: Great! Just missing a few things
customer_reviews.text: My Piper works great and currently has 2 motion sensors and 3 door sensors connected to it. Everything works perfectly as advertised so below I will state the additions that would make this product a must have for every household: -Web application for online security administration -Custom API for triggers -External HD suppoct -Keypad support for home security Off the top of my head those things would make this product perfect and a must buy for everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Works good most of the time
customer_reviews.text: Works good most of the time. I only give three instead of four stars because of the handful of times it wouldn't start up. We've had this one for about 11 months and it has been good for piece of mind being able to watch our second home.
customer_reviews.author: I like reviews

product_meta.title: Piper nv Smart Home Security System with Night Vision, 180-degree Video Camera, White
product_meta.description: Color:WhitePiper nv is the only wireless portable security system that focuses on what matters most to you - right out of the box and with no monthly fees. With Piper nv’s day/night HD camera and optional wireless accessories, you can see, hear and know exactly what’s happening in your home or office using your smartphone or tablet. Get alerts by email, text, phone or push notifications when Piper nv detects activities that are important to you. Piper nv has been thoughtfully designed to avoid the pitfalls of other portable security systems on the market.
feature_bullets: AC Power - Only the power adapter provided with Piper should be used with the equipment. Input: 100-240 V AC, 50Hz, maximum input current 0.3A. Output: 5VDC, maximum output current 2A (current limited). Output connector: Tip (inner part) positive, barrel (outer part) negative.
Smart home security system with no contracts or monthly fees required. High resolution 180-degree immersive view camera with night vision, for live and recorded video
Motion/sound detection, temperature/light/humidity sensors, 2-way audio and 105 dB siren
Simple setup and easy to use, get text/email alerts and check in from your smartphone or tablet (iOS and Android)
Connects via Wi-Fi, battery backup, high grade SSL video encryption, compatible with Z-Wave wireless accessories; auto-rearms to capture multiple events and pet adjustable motion detection
